page.title: 03Trunk roads
page.content: The A38 and A380 roads pass through this block.They are the main routes for holiday traffic into Devon,and carry very heavy traffic throughout the summer.Haldon Hill and Telegraph Hill,on the A38 and A380 respectively,used to be well known for their traffic holdups,but road improvements in the 1970s have created dual carriageways,and holdups are now unusual,except for road works.However both roads can become impassable in winter due to ice and snow, and Devon County Council has a priority to try to keep them open.Industrial development in Plymouth and the Roscof ferry to France have led to an increased number of heavy goods vehicles using these roads.The roads also make it possible for commuters from rural Devon to reach Exeter.
